intro: Lasianthus perakensis var. perakensis, commonly known as the Java orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), while its inflorescence bears multiple small, showy blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forests.
